tests.fullTitle: A verifiable credential ... vc MUST be present in a JWT verifiable credential.
tests.title: vc MUST be present in a JWT verifiable credential.

suites.title: To encode a verifiable credential as a JWT, specific properties introduced by thisspecification MUST be either 1) encoded as standard JOSE header parameters, 2) encoded as registered JWT claim names, or 3) contained in the JWS signature part...

tests.fullTitle: To encode a verifiable credential as a JWT, specific properties introduced by thisspecification MUST be either 1) encoded as standard JOSE header parameters, 2) encoded as registered JWT claim names, or 3) contained in the JWS signature part... If no explicit rule is specified, properties are encoded in the same way as with a standardverifiable credential, and are added to the vc property of the JWT.
tests.title: If no explicit rule is specified, properties are encoded in the same way as with a standardverifiable credential, and are added to the vc property of the JWT.

tests.fullTitle: To encode a verifiable credential as a JWT, specific properties introduced by thisspecification MUST be either 1) encoded as standard JOSE header parameters, 2) encoded as registered JWT claim names, or 3) contained in the JWS signature part... if typ is present, it MUST be set to JWT.
tests.title: if typ is present, it MUST be set to JWT.

tests.fullTitle: To encode a verifiable credential as a JWT, specific properties introduced by thisspecification MUST be either 1) encoded as standard JOSE header parameters, 2) encoded as registered JWT claim names, or 3) contained in the JWS signature part... alg MUST be used for RSA and ECDSA-based digital signatures.
tests.title: alg MUST be used for RSA and ECDSA-based digital signatures.

tests.fullTitle: To encode a verifiable credential as a JWT, specific properties introduced by thisspecification MUST be either 1) encoded as standard JOSE header parameters, 2) encoded as registered JWT claim names, or 3) contained in the JWS signature part... If no JWS is present, a proof property MUST be provided.
tests.title: If no JWS is present, a proof property MUST be provided.

tests.fullTitle: To encode a verifiable credential as a JWT, specific properties introduced by thisspecification MUST be either 1) encoded as standard JOSE header parameters, 2) encoded as registered JWT claim names, or 3) contained in the JWS signature part... If only the proof attribute is used, the alg header MUST be set to none.
tests.title: If only the proof attribute is used, the alg header MUST be set to none.

tests.fullTitle: To encode a verifiable credential as a JWT, specific properties introduced by thisspecification MUST be either 1) encoded as standard JOSE header parameters, 2) encoded as registered JWT claim names, or 3) contained in the JWS signature part... exp MUST represent expirationDate, encoded as a UNIX timestamp (NumericDate).
tests.title: exp MUST represent expirationDate, encoded as a UNIX timestamp (NumericDate).

tests.fullTitle: To encode a verifiable credential as a JWT, specific properties introduced by thisspecification MUST be either 1) encoded as standard JOSE header parameters, 2) encoded as registered JWT claim names, or 3) contained in the JWS signature part... exp MUST represent expirationDate, encoded as a UNIX timestamp (NumericDate) -- negative, no exp expected.
tests.title: exp MUST represent expirationDate, encoded as a UNIX timestamp (NumericDate) -- negative, no exp expected.

tests.fullTitle: To encode a verifiable credential as a JWT, specific properties introduced by thisspecification MUST be either 1) encoded as standard JOSE header parameters, 2) encoded as registered JWT claim names, or 3) contained in the JWS signature part... iss MUST represent the issuer property.
tests.title: iss MUST represent the issuer property.

tests.fullTitle: To encode a verifiable credential as a JWT, specific properties introduced by thisspecification MUST be either 1) encoded as standard JOSE header parameters, 2) encoded as registered JWT claim names, or 3) contained in the JWS signature part... nbf MUST represent issuanceDate, encoded as a UNIX timestamp (NumericDate).
tests.title: nbf MUST represent issuanceDate, encoded as a UNIX timestamp (NumericDate).

tests.fullTitle: To encode a verifiable credential as a JWT, specific properties introduced by thisspecification MUST be either 1) encoded as standard JOSE header parameters, 2) encoded as registered JWT claim names, or 3) contained in the JWS signature part... jti MUST represent the id property of the verifiable credential.
tests.title: jti MUST represent the id property of the verifiable credential.

tests.fullTitle: To encode a verifiable credential as a JWT, specific properties introduced by thisspecification MUST be either 1) encoded as standard JOSE header parameters, 2) encoded as registered JWT claim names, or 3) contained in the JWS signature part... jti MUST represent the id property of the verifiable credential -- negative, no jti expected
tests.title: jti MUST represent the id property of the verifiable credential -- negative, no jti expected

tests.fullTitle: To encode a verifiable credential as a JWT, specific properties introduced by thisspecification MUST be either 1) encoded as standard JOSE header parameters, 2) encoded as registered JWT claim names, or 3) contained in the JWS signature part... sub MUST represent the id property contained in the verifiable credential subject.
tests.title: sub MUST represent the id property contained in the verifiable credential subject.

tests.fullTitle: To encode a verifiable credential as a JWT, specific properties introduced by thisspecification MUST be either 1) encoded as standard JOSE header parameters, 2) encoded as registered JWT claim names, or 3) contained in the JWS signature part... Additional claims MUST be added to the credentialSubject property of the JWT.
tests.title: Additional claims MUST be added to the credentialSubject property of the JWT.

suites.title: To decode a JWT to a standard verifiable credential, the following transformation MUST be performed...

tests.fullTitle: To decode a JWT to a standard verifiable credential, the following transformation MUST be performed... Add the content from the vc property to the new JSON object.
tests.title: Add the content from the vc property to the new JSON object.

suites.title: To transform the JWT specific headers and claims, the following MUST be done:

tests.fullTitle: To transform the JWT specific headers and claims, the following MUST be done: If exp is present, the UNIX timestamp MUST be converted to an [RFC3339] date-time, and MUST be used to set the value of the expirationDate property of credentialSubject of the new JSON object.
tests.title: If exp is present, the UNIX timestamp MUST be converted to an [RFC3339] date-time, and MUST be used to set the value of the expirationDate property of credentialSubject of the new JSON object.

tests.fullTitle: To transform the JWT specific headers and claims, the following MUST be done: If iss is present, the value MUST be used to set the issuer property of the new JSON object.
tests.title: If iss is present, the value MUST be used to set the issuer property of the new JSON object.

tests.fullTitle: To transform the JWT specific headers and claims, the following MUST be done: If nbf is present, the UNIX timestamp MUST be converted to an [RFC3339] date-time, and MUST be used to set the value of the issuanceDate property of the new JSON object.
tests.title: If nbf is present, the UNIX timestamp MUST be converted to an [RFC3339] date-time, and MUST be used to set the value of the issuanceDate property of the new JSON object.

tests.fullTitle: To transform the JWT specific headers and claims, the following MUST be done: If sub is present, the value MUST be used to set the value of the id property of credentialSubject of the new JSON object.
tests.title: If sub is present, the value MUST be used to set the value of the id property of credentialSubject of the new JSON object.

tests.fullTitle: To transform the JWT specific headers and claims, the following MUST be done: If jti is present, the value MUST be used to set the value of the id property of the new JSON object.
tests.title: If jti is present, the value MUST be used to set the value of the id property of the new JSON object.
